DataElement.preferredName: Person Bone Marrow Liver Spleen Evaluation Ind-3
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/unknown indicator that asks whether the bone marrow, liver, and/or spleen were evaluated.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Bone Marrow Liver Spleen Evaluation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to an evaluation of the bone marrow (the soft, sponge-like tissue in the center of bones that produces white blood cells, red blood cells, and platelets), liver (a large organ located in the upper abdomen that cleanses the blood and aids in digestion), and spleen (an organ that is part of the lymphatic system and produces lymphocytes, filters the blood, stores blood cells, and destroys old blood cells).

Property.preferredDefinition: The soft, sponge-like tissue in the center of bones that produces white blood cells, red blood cells, and platelets.:A large organ located in the upper abdomen. The liver cleanses the blood and aids in digestion by secreting bile.:An organ that is part of the lymphatic system. The spleen produces lymphocytes, filters the blood, stores blood cells, and destroys old blood cells. It is located on the left side of the abdomen near the stomach.:Evaluation; the act of placing value on something.

Concepts.definition: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.

A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.

An organ that is part of the hematopoietic and immune systems. It is composed of the white pulp and the red pulp and is surrounded by a capsule. It is located in the left hypochondriac region. Its functions include lymphocyte production, blood cell storage, and blood cell destruction.
Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.
